name: South Park Commons Founder Fellowship
terms: $400k for 7% plus $600k in the following round
notes: Batch starts beginning of October

name: Y Combinator
notes: Batch runs October to December, application deadline 8pm PT August 4th, decision by September 5th

name: Conviction Embed
description: Run by Sarah Guo, pre-seed and seed-stage for “AI-native” companies
notes: In person retreat September 19-21, demo day in November

name: Berkeley SkyDeck
description: Pre-seed accelerator run by UC Berkeley Haas Business School
notes: Appear to have strong preference for UC Berkeley affiliated companies, but unclear if affiliation is a requirement. “Fund will also invest up to 10% of your first institutional funding round”

name: Alliance Accelerator
terms: $450k for 9% SAFE with a 1:1.5 token side letter

name: Alchemist Accelerator
terms: Average of $25k net (minus tuition fees) for 5% equity grant
notes: Has tuition fee, equity exchanged as a grant, unclear on exact terms. “Most Alchemist companies grant 5.0% of equity, but Alchemist has flexible terms.”

name: AI2 Incubator
description: Run by Allen Institute for AI
terms: $50K-150K initial investment , unclear terms, additional investment right up to $500k
notes: Teams also may get up to $1M in compute. Lots of “may” and “up to” and “optional” here.

name: Founders, Inc. Fellowship
notes: Terms appear to vary on both funding and equity

name: LAUNCH Accelerator
description: Run by Jason Calacanis for "pre-Series A with some traction"
notes: Additional terms for follow on investment. Next batch in August.

name: 500 Startups
notes: Terms include “right to make a follow-on investment of an additional $500,000 or 20% of your next priced round of $1,000,000 or more, whichever is lower”. Terms listed are for Flagship program.

name: Forum Accelerator
description: B2B SaaS accelerator from Forum Ventures

name: Village Global Velocity
notes: Unclear how hands on the program is

name: Antler Residency
description: Pre-seed program in cities around the world
notes: Listed terms for US residency

name: Iterative
notes: Batch runs February to May

name: HF0 Residency
notes: Terms take 5% equity and the SAFE converts at terms of next financing. Application is open but no dates listed. Now appears to be seed stage focused.

name: a16z Speedrun
description: a16z accelerator for technology x entertainment
notes: Expanded from games focus

name: The Mint
description: Fintech pre-seed, run by Better Tomorrow Ventures
notes: Unclear if this still runs

name: Sequoia Arc
description: Pre-seed & Seed-stage, from one of the biggest VCs
notes: A rc Fall ‘25 will kick off in October. Word is no longer a full program

name: AI Grant
description: Created by Nat Friedman & Daniel Gross
notes: Unclear if this program will continue after Nat Friedman joined Meta

name: Techstars
terms: $20k for 6%, plus an optional $100k convertible note
notes: Many different city and subject accelerators with different dates

name: NEO Accelerator
terms: 1.5% common stock grant plus $600k uncapped SAFE w/ time-limited $10M floor valuation
notes: Complicated but good terms

name: Entrepreneur First
terms: $12k talent grant, non-guaranteed 8% equity grant plus up to $250k uncapped
notes: Terms are complicated, see explanation here .

name: Betaworks Camp
terms: $250k from BetaWorks on an uncapped SAFE w/ 25% discount, plus a 5% common stock take, plus up to $250k from syndicate at same terms and discount
notes: Last batch focused on AI interfaces
